abstract: Owners of property with at least $40,000 market value in Inkster, Mich, will pay around $130 more on July tax bills than usual to fund settlement Detroit suburb reached over beating of Floyd Dent by police Officer William Melendez during traffic stop.
lead_paragraph: Property owners in Inkster, a Detroit suburb, are getting the bill for a $1.4 million settlement with a man seen on video being repeatedly punched in the head by a police officer during a traffic stop.

headline.main: Michigan: Town Billing Taxpayers for $1.4. Million Police Settlement
headline.print_headline: Michigan: Town Billing Taxpayers for $1.4. Million Police Settlement

snippet: Property owners in Inkster, a Detroit suburb, are getting the bill for a $1.4 million settlement with a man seen on video being repeatedly punched in the head by a police officer during a traffic stop.
